info.title: Clash of Wisdom
info.description: Clash of Wisdom is a PvP trivia game created by Ravio Games. This documentation provides information only for developers who are building functionality in iOS, Android and other channels.

question.question: Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?
Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?
Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?

post.description:
Use this endpoint to send the final score of one or more ended games to the server.

**Flow Diagram**:
![Flow Diagram](https://s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/docs.bonetwork.co/apps/bilgisavasi/openapi/flows/get.gameplays.finalize.png)

get.description:
Use this endpoint to start a game for player. If you provide a count that is greater than 1 then you can get more games at once and use them as a precache to speed up new game starting process.

!!! NOTE: Currently only std10 game type is accepted.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description:
Number of items to be returned. No more than 50 items can be returned at one query.

**Example:**
?count=10

401.description: This response is returned for all unauthorized access attempts

value.message: Your request has been successfully completed.

get.description: Use this endpoint to check the end result of a game play. This endpoint must be used if game result is not provided after calling POST :: /gameplay/progress/init endpoint.

200.description: Returns "match request id".

value.message: Your request has been successfully completed.

get.description: Use this endpoint to request a PVP game "match request id". When this request reaches the server, the server creates a match request id and it returns this id as result set of the response. The request is queued and handled asynchronously. Therefore a second call is needed to be made with the request id provided from this endpoint to start the game play.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Match reqest id.

200.description: OK

questions.question: Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?
What two colors are in Turkish flag?
Which actor played the original Terminator?
Which profession did Arnold Schwarzenneger not do?
Who is regarded as the founding father of the Republic of Turkiye?
What color are the taxis in New York City?
Who played Eva Peron in the movie Don'T Cry For Me Argentina?
What does BMW stand for?
In which year did Covid-19 pandemic struck the entire world?
Which of the following is not a mobile phone brand?

value.message: Your request has been successfully completed.

get.description: Use this endpoint to start/load a PVP game for a given request id. For this endpoint to function the gameplay progress of the request id must belong to the authenticated player. The result set of the response is a "PvpMatch" model (https://docs.bonetwork.co/bilgisavasi/pvpmatch).

200.description: If request is susccessful, result set returns AppInit model (https://docs.bonetwork.co/bilgisavasi/appinit(/

value.message: Your request has been successfully completed.

get.description: This is the first endpoint you need to use. It provides you environment specifics initialization values.

parameters.name: X-Device-Id
parameters.description: This is generated & stored in device. It is similar to session token; except, this is generated and saved once into device memory.

parameters.name: X-Firebase-Token
parameters.description: This is the unique token generated by Firebase for the device. It must be provided only if there is a value obtained from Firabse.

200.description: If successful, response's result set will return Player model (https://docs.bonetwork.co/bilgisavasi/player).

value.message: Your request has been successfully completed.

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a new player record, if you cannot find a matching player record.

200.description: If successful, response's result set will return Player model (https://docs.bonetwork.co/bilgisavasi/player).

value.message: Your request has been successfully completed.

get.description: Use this endpoint to grab a specific player's standard profile information. If id equals to "null", the information provided will be equal to the player who is tied to the session token provided in header with key X-Session-Token.

parameters.name: X-Player-Id
parameters.description: This should be supplied only if there is a player id available in device memory.

parameters.name: X-Device-Id
parameters.description: This is the device specific id, generated for the user.

parameters.name: X-Firebase-Token
parameters.description: This is the unique identifier supplied for the player/device by Firebase. It must be send only if there is a value obtained from Firebase.

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: Platform can be one of the following: google, apple

200.description: If successful, response's result set will return Player model (https://docs.bonetwork.co/bilgisavasi/player).

value.message: Your request has been successfully completed.

post.description: Use this endpoint to register a player's social account information and connect her/his social account with her/his game account.

parameters.name: X-Player-Id
parameters.description: This should be supplied only if there is a player id available in device memory.

parameters.name: X-Device-Id
parameters.description: This is the device specific id, generated for the user.

get.description:
Use this endpoint to get the total number of items that a user possesses for a given power-up.

Available keys are:
- fiftyFifty (integer)
- immortality (ImmortalityInfo model)
- immunity (ImmunityInfo model)
- life (integer)
- majority (integer)
- joker (integer)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Player's uuid.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the power-up to grab.

value.message: Your request has been successfully completed.

post.summary: Register Gameplay Progress of a Player

200.description: On success, it returns 200.0000 with PvpResult model (https://docs.bonetwork.co/bilgisavasi/pvpresult). If the opponent is still playing the game is still active and not finalized, then

value.message: Your request has been successfully completed.
Not all players have finished the game yet. Please wait a little bit and try again to see the final result of the game.

post.description:
This endpoint is used to register a single gameplay progress. It is mainly used in PVP games to register a player's gameplay progress to the system.

**Flow Diagram**:
![Flow Diagram](https://s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/docs.bonetwork.co/apps/bilgisavasi/openapi/flows/post.pameplay.progress.png)

question.question: Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?

requestBody.description: A single gameplay progress must be submitted within the body. The submitted gameplay progress must have a valid ID and it should belong to the user who owns the current session unless the user has necessary management privileges. https://docs.bonetwork.co/bilgisavasi/gameplayprogress

put.summary: Complete Reward Log After Viewing Ad
put.description: Use this endpoint to complete an existing reward log which is waiting to close. And also gives rewards of viewing to player.

status.description: a: active, i: inactive, d: deleted

AdRewardInstructions.title: AdRewardInstructions
AdRewardInstructions.description: This object defines reward actions to be completed in a standard way when an ad is viewd.

AdRewardInstructionValue.title: AdRewardInstructionValue
AdRewardInstructionValue.description: This object standardizes the value parameter of each reward-related property of ProductInstructions mode..

value.description: The value to be added to player's account. Only valid if type is set to "v".

multiplier.description: The multiplier defines how many moretimes of an earned rewards a player will get. For example if this is an experience reward and the player has already earned 100 XP; if the type is set to "m" and multiplier is set to "2" then the player will earn not 100 XP but 2 x 100 = 200 XP. This is only valid if type is set to  "m".

type.description: m: use multiplier, v: use value

AdRewardLogItem.title: AdRewardLogItem
AdRewardLogItem.description: This object is a simplified representation of a "player" that includes uuid, username, and avatar info.

initializedAt.description: Time when the ad view is initialized.

viewedAt.description: This is the player's public avatar. If the player has not set an avatar then this field must be filled with a random avatar image that is created by the system.

rewardedAt.description: Time when the reward is added to player's account.

nextRewardTryAt.description: Used only if the status is stuck in "w".

player.description: UUID of player who has viewed the ad.

AppInfo.title: AppInfo
AppInfo.description: This is a helper model used in AppInit object. It holds application specific instructions.

forceUpdate.description: If set to true, this device needs to redirect user to  app's store and force user to upgrade the app. This is calculated automatically by the API using the API key.

AppInit.title: AppInit
AppInit.description: This is the object that is to be given to the app during its first initialization.

ApiPagination.title: ApiPagination
ApiPagination.description: If the result set is a list, then this object will guide you to paginate the result set. Note that a limit enforcement is in effect even if you do not provide a limit to the result set.

isCircular.description: If set to true, pagination's next page link points the first page of collection when navigating the last page.

prevLink.description: The query string that is required to obtain the previous page's items.

nextLink.description: The query string that is required to obtain the next page's items.

lastLink.description: The query string that is required to obtain the last page's items.

firstLink.description: The query string that is required to obtain the first page's items.

totalItems.description: Number of total items based on given filter.

itemsPerPage.description: Number of results to be shown at each request. This is calculated base on the parameters submitted by request.

pageCount.description: Total number of pages. This is calculated base on the parameters submitted by request.

currentPage.description: Current page number. This is calculated base on the parameters submitted by request.

ApiResponse.title: ApiResponse
ApiResponse.description: This is the standart response object. All of your request to api will return this object.

Example-200.0000-null.message: Your request has been successfully completed.
Your request has been successfully completed.

sessionToken.description: This is the session token, and it will only revealed if user logs in the system with username and password, or if an already logged-in user needs to refresh its existing token.

message.example: Your request has been successfully completed.

ApiResult.title: ApiResult
ApiResult.description: If response returns a result, the result set will be stored here alongside with any available pagination information.

locale.description: Default locale of the UI. This is replaced by user settings.

gameEffects.description: By default sound effects are ON. If the user has a related setting, user setting will override this one.

gameMusic.description: By default sound effects are ON. If the user has a related setting, user setting will override this one.

gameStartTimer.description: This should be a small integer value that represents the number of seconds a player should wait before a  game starts.

maxTickets.description: Number of maximum tickets a player can have at a given time. see: MAX_LIVES

timeToRegenerateTicket.description: Time in seconds to regenerate a spent ticket. see: TIME_TO_REGENERATE_TICKET

ticketCheckInterval.description: Time in seconds to check for ticket updates. see: LIFE_CHECK_INTERVAL

gameEffects.description: By default sound effects are ON. If the user has a related setting, user setting will override this one.

gameMusic.description: By default sound effects are ON. If the user has a related setting, user setting will override this one.

NotificationSettings.title: NotificationSettings
NotificationSettings.description: This is a collection that store's players' notification settings.

leaderboardNotifications.description: Should player be notified for leaderboard related notifications...

gameResultNotifications.description: Should player be notified for game result related notifications...

marketingNotifications.description: Should player be notified for promotional reasons...

paymentNotifications.description: Should player be notified for payment related notifications...

legalNotifications.description: Should player be notified for legal purposes such as update in user agreement, being banned, etc.

GameplayAnswer.title: GameplayAnswer
GameplayAnswer.description: This is a simple representation of player's answers to each trivia question.

question.question: Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?

id.description: System attained id. Must be null during POST requests.

status.description:
The current status of question/answer.

- a: asked, but not yet answered.
- e: expired, asked but not answered within the given time limit.
- p: answered, with a power up within the time limit.
- r: answered, within the time limit.

questionIdx.description: The array/list index number of trivia questions.

selectedChoice.description: If the answer is expired or a power up is used then this field should be set to null.

isCorrect.description: Indicates if the given answer is correct.

coinsEarned.description: Number of coins earned from this question.

timeSpent.description: Time a player took to answer (in seconds).

experienceEarned.description: The exÃ„Å¸erience that player has earned towards her/his total player level experience points.

askedAt.description: Time when the UI displayed the question to the player.

answeredAt.description: Time when the user answered the question (selected a choice or used a powerup to answer - joker).

GameplayProgress.title: GameplayProgress
GameplayProgress.description: This object must be used to track a player's gameplay progress.

lastAnsweredQuestion.description: The array index of the last answered question by the user.

correctAnswers.description: Number of total correct answers including power ups.

status.description:
status of the game play progress.
- s: started
- p: in progress
- f: finished
- t: timed out

coinsAccumulated.description: Total points accumulated by the player so far. Coins & score is close relatives but are not the same thing.

coinsInsured.description: Total points insured by the player.

lastInsuranceCheckpoint.description: The index number of the question where the player has last triggered an insurance event.

startedAt.description: Start date of game play progress.

updatedAt.description: Time when the progress is last updated.

winStatus.description:
Win status is only set after game is finihed.
- l: loss
- t: tie
- u: undecided
- w: win

points.description: Points earned from the game. This is set to 0 until the game ends. Loss worths 0 points, tie worths 1 point, and win worths 3 points.

score.description: Score is the in-game points accumulated with each correct answer and it is closely tied to the difficulty level of questions.

playerAnswers.description: The answers provded by the player during the game play.

game.description: The game that progress belongs to.

experienceEarned.description: Total experience earned from this game play.

PlayerLeaderboardStanding.title: PlayerLeaderboardStanding
PlayerLeaderboardStanding.description: A simple representation of the leaderboard that includes selected player's standing information.

weekTitle.description: Verbal title of the current league's weekly sub-ivision.

LeaderboardScreen.title: LeaderboardScreen
LeaderboardScreen.description: A representation of the leaderboard combined with standings and mobile screen required elements.

endsAt.description: Date & time when the league of leaderboard is being closed.

LeaderboardStanding.title: LeaderboardStanding
LeaderboardStanding.description: Holds player's standing information for the given leaderboard.

currentRank.description: Player's current ranking within the leaderboard.

accumulatedPoints.description: Player's accumulated points in current week.

accumlatedScore.description: Player's accumulated score in current week.

zoneCode.description: The zone that the player resides within the leaderboard.

totalPlayers.description: Number of total players in player's leaderboard.

LeagueInfo.title: LeagueInfo

leagueEndsAt.description: The last day of the current league.

LeagueInfo.description: This is a simple object which is used to provide active league related information to the client.

LifeInfo.title: LifeInfo
LifeInfo.description: Holds simple details about a user's life.

currentCount.description: Current life count of the user.

isFull.description: A marker to quickly check if the user has restored all his lives.

Player.title: Player
Player.description: This object is a true representation of a "player".

uuid.description: System defined unique identifier of the user. For post, it should be set to null.

alias.description: Player's alias / username. This is visible to everyone within the game.

avatar.description: This is the player's public avatar. If the player has not set an avatar then this field must be filled with a random avatar image that is created by the system.

coins.description: Number of curretn total wisdom coins of player. Wisdom coin is an in-game monetary unit.

PlayerSummary.title: PlayerSummary
PlayerSummary.description: This object is a simplified representation of a "player" that includes uuid, username, and avatar info.

uuid.description: System defined unique identifier of the user. For post, it should be set to null.

alias.description: Player's alias / username. This is visible to everyone within the game.

avatar.description: This is the player's public avatar. If the player has not set an avatar then this field must be filled with a random avatar image that is created by the system.

PlayerLevelSummary.title: PlayerLevelSummary
PlayerLevelSummary.description: The model is used to present a player's game level related basic information in a standard way.

accumulatedPoints.description: The player's total accumulated points so far.

pointsToNextLevel.description: Total points to be achieved for player to reach the next level.

PlayerPowerUps.title: PlayerPowerUps
PlayerPowerUps.description: Holds basic information about how many of a given powerup a user currently possesses.

life.description: "Life" limits the number of solo game plays of a player within a  given period.

insurance.description: "Insurance" guarantees that a user earns all coins even if she/he is eliminated in a game.

joker.description: "Joker" enables user to bypass a quiz question as if she/he has given the correct answer.

fiftyFifty.description: "FityFifty" eliminates all wrong answers except one leaving one correct and one incorrect answer at player's selection.

majority.description: "Majority" automatically selects the answer for the quiz question based on the polling of the historic seleections of other players.

PlayerTagStatItem.title: PlayerTagStatItem
PlayerTagStatItem.description: Holds simple statistics of players grouped by a categories.

successRate.description: Player's success rate for questions with this tag that player has answered.

correct.description: Total number of correct answer excluding power ups.

Product.title: Product
Product.description: This object is a simple representation of a product.

Example-1.title: Hazine Kesesi Kombo Paketi
Example-1.description: 1.000 AltÄ±n + 100 XP + 7 boyunca 2 joker ve 3er adet %50 ve Ã§oÄŸunluk gÃ¼cÃ¼.

store.description: a: android, b: bip, f: facebook, h: huawei, i: ios, w: web

sku.description: Product code, it must be equal to the code given in the corresponding app store.

storeTier.description: It is used for informative purposes.

taxIncluded.description: Indicates if the given price is tax inclusive or exclusive.

value.title: GÃ¼Ã§ Paketleri
value.description: %50 gÃ¼cÃ¼ paketlerinde bugÃ¼ne Ã¶zel %50 indirimi kaÃ§Ä±rma!

ProductInstructions.title: ProductInstructions
ProductInstructions.description: This object defines all possible reward actions to be completed when a product is purchased by a player.

isRecurring.description: If set to true the reward must be given periodically.

recursionType.description: d: daily, m: monthly, w:weekly, y: yearly, x: none.

recursionDuration.description: Maximum number of times a recursion will occur. Extra mechanisms needed to track per player activities.

lives.description: Number of lives to be added to player's account at each recursion.

immortalityDuration.description: An integer value representing hours. For example, 4 means 4 hours. The player won't spend any lives for opening games during this period. Extra mechanisms needed to track per player activities.

immunityDuration.description: An integer value representing hours. For example, 4 means 4 hours. The player won't spend any coins for opening games during this period. Extra mechanisms needed to track per player activities.

joker.description: Number of joker power that purchasing player will earn.

majority.description: Number of majority power that purchasing player will earn.

fiftyFifty.description: Number of fifty fifty power that purchasing player will earn.

insurance.description: Number of insurance power that purchasing player will earn..

experience.description: Number of experience points to be added to player's account at each recursion.

coins.description: Number of coins to be added to player's account at each recursion.

PvpMatch.title: PvpMatch
PvpMatch.description: This object provides details of the PVP game started and details of the opponent player.

gameplayProgressId.description: Progress id created for the user for this game.

PvpResult.title: PvpResult
PvpResult.description: This object provides pvp game play results.

question.question: Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?
Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?

playerStatus.description: Player's win status. l: lost, t: tied, w: won

PvpResultSummary.title: PvpResultSummary
PvpResultSummary.description: This object provides summary information about pvp gameplay results.

playerStatus.description: Player's win status. l: lost, t: tied, w: won

PurchaseResult.title: PurchaseResult
PurchaseResult.description: This object is used to respond purchase requests.

immortality.description: Number of hours that immortality will be available.

immunity.description: Number of hours that immunity will be available.

RewardDistribution.title: RewardDistribution
RewardDistribution.description: This is a helper object that defines the number of items that a user earns by answering the related question correctly.

isActive.description: If set to false, the rewards won't get distributed..

RewardInfo.title: RewardInfo
RewardInfo.description: This is a helper object that defines the number of items that a user earns by answering the related question correctly.

coins.description: Coin amount that a player can win.

experience.description: Experience / player level a player can win.

score.description: Score to be earned from this question.

TriviaQuiz.title: TrviaQuiz
TriviaQuiz.description: This is the representation of a single trivia quiz shown to players.

theme.description: Theme is used to tag quizes into specified groups. Themed quizes consists of questions from the same genre / tag.

difficultyLevel.description: This is an indicator of average difficulty of quiz. It is calculated by finding the average value of questions that are associated with this quiz.

countQuestions.description: Number of questions associated with this quiz.

fee.description: The entrance fee to open this game. This is an integer value represent,ng the "GANIMET" amount to be deducted from player's chest.

TriviaQuizChoice.title: TriviaQuizChoice
TriviaQuizChoice.description: This model represents a single choice in a trivia quiz question.

isCorrect.description: Indicates if this is the correct choice to the question.

answerCount.description: Number of people who have selected this answer.

TriviaQuizQuestion.title: TriviaQuizQuestion
TriviaQuizQuestion.description: This model represents single question in a trivia quiz.

Example-1.question: Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?

value.question: Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?

question.example: Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?
question.description: The actual question to be answered.

bannerImage.description: The path to the banner image, if it does exist..

choices.description: Minimum of two choices are required.

difficultyLevel.description: The difficulty level of question. This also defines how much coin a user earns by answering this question correctly.

duration.description: Number of seconds that player will have to provide an answer or to use a power-up.

ImmunityInfo.title: ImmunityInfo
ImmunityInfo.description: This helper info provides details about player's immunity status.

validUntil.description: Time when the power will drain.

ImmortalityInfo.title: ImmortalityInfo
ImmortalityInfo.description: This helper info provides details about player's immortality status.

validUntil.description: Time when the power will drain.

PlayerGcInfo.title: PlayerGcInfo
PlayerGcInfo.description: This model represents player data that is taken from game centers.

avatar.description: URL of the player's avatar as stored in game center.

email.description: E-mail of the player's data as stored in game center.

alias.description: Alias of the player as stored in game center.

groupCount.description: Number of groups associated with this leaderboard.

playersPerGroup.description: Number of maximum players who can be part of the groups which have been associated with this leaderboard.

playerCount.description: Total number of players who have been associated with this leaderboard.

maxPlayers.description: Maximum number of players who can be associated with this leaderboard.

levelUpTo.description: Id of the leaderboard where promoted players will be placed.

levelDownTo.description: Id of the leaderboard where de-promoted players will be placed.

LeaderboardGroup.title: LeaderboardGroup
LeaderboardGroup.description: A simple representation of leaderboard group.

playerCount.description: Total number of players who have been associated with this leaderboard.

maxPlayers.description: Maximum number of players who can be associated with this leaderboard.

otherPlayerCount.description: Number of non-promoted and non-demoted players.

levelUpTo.description: Leaderboard group that promoted players will be assigned.

levelDownToA.description: Leaderboard group that the first 10 de-promoted players will be assigned.

levelDownToB.description: Leaderboard group that the second 10 de-promoted players will be assigned.

SocialAccountInfo.title: SocialAccountInfo

token.description: Social account token of the player as provided from the social platform SDK.

avatar.description: URL of player's social account's avatar.

SocialAccountInfo.description: Holds details from the social account provider in a standardized way.

TQIssueRequest.title: TQIssueRequest
TQIssueRequest.description: Represents the structure of a issue request related to trivia questions.

id.description: System defined identification number. Must be set to NULL in CREATE processes.

createdAt.description: Date when the issue is submitted by the player.

respondedAt.description: Time when the issue has been last updated by the admin.

rewardedAt.description: Date when the reward is sent to player.

player.description: Player who has submitted the issue.

question.description: The disputed question's id if it is known to the player.

playerComments.description: Issue related comments of the player.

issueId.description: Project management task id - if available.

response.description: Admin's response to the issue request.

TransactionBasic.title: TransactionBasic
TransactionBasic.description: This model represents a transaction with the bare minimum requirements.

id.description: System given id - given by the API server.

storeId.description: Transaction id obtained from store (app store, playstore etc.).

player.description: The id of the player who is making the purchase.

product.description: Id or SKU of the product. Whichever is present..

TransactionWithStoreInfo.title: TransactionWithStoreInfo
TransactionWithStoreInfo.description: This model represents a transaction with the bare minimum requirements + store information.

storeId.description: Transaction id obtained from store (app store, playstore etc.).

player.description: The id of the player who is making the purchase.

product.description: Id or SKU of the product. Whichever is present..

isSuccessful.description: If player's purchase is successfull: true, otherwise: false

failReason.description: If not successful, then store provided fail reason / code.

SuggestedQuestion.title: SuggestedQuestion
SuggestedQuestion.description: This is a reflection of the suggested_question table.

player.description: UUID of the player who has submitted this suggestion.

status.description: Status of suggestion. a: accepted, r: rejected, u: under review

rewarded.description: If reward has sent true, then false.

rejectionReason.description: q: does not match to our quality standards, i: contains invalid information, d: duplicate, question already exists

question.question: Which actor did not play the role "Bruce Wayne" in any of the Batman movies?

x-locale.description: Sets UI locale. Default value is always en-us.

X-Api-Key.description: The api key will be provided you by the team lead or project manager.
X-Api-Key.name: Application's API Key.

X-Session-Token.name: Session Token
X-Session-Token.description: Session token is a unique token which is assigned to actual users. This information is tied to players id, and used to identify the player who interacts with the system.

500.Generic.description: 500 response is returned only if there is an unexpected & unhandled error during the execution of the program.

value.message: An unexpected error occured. You can contact our support team if the error continues.

401.Generic.description: 401 responses are returned either if the user is not loggeding or if the user has insufficient privileges.

value.message: Your session is expired. Please re-login.
Please check your username and password, and try again.

You have failed to login many times. Your account is suspended for ... hours. You have been sent a security key to your primary contact option. You can either wait ... hours or you can follow the instructions provided.
There is an issue with your device identification number. You are welcome to contact our support team if the issue persists.
Your transaction limit exceeded. Please contact our billing department for more information.
You do not have enough permissions to access this feature.
You are allowed to update the same entry only ... times within ... minutes. Please, either wait a little bit and try again, or contact your manager for further information.

412.Generic.description: 412 responses are fired if there is a conditional error occured due to malformed requests to API.

value.message: limit parameter must be an integer value between 1 and 200.
offset parameter must be an integer value that is greater than or equal to 0.
order parameter has one or more unsupported operands. See related documentation for more information.
order parameter has one or more unsupported options. See related documentation for more information.
You have provided an invalid value for the status parameter. Please check related documentation for accepted values.
Please check your date values. Accepted date format is: ... Accepted date-time format is: ... Accepted time format is: ...
You have provided an unsupported operand for the date queries. Please check related documentation and correct your request.
... is required. Please supply a value for this parameter.
Preliminary data validation failed. Please check related service documentation.
You have supplied an invalid data. Please check releated documentation, fix all your issues and try again. If the problem persists, you can contact our support team.
The supplied path parameter is invalid or a required path parameter is missing.
The value, operands, or options are not valid for the ... . Please check related documentation for more information.

200.0000.NoResult.description: This standard response is returned in cases where there is nothing actually to returnto the client.

value.message: Your request has been successfully completed.

200.0000.GameList.description: This standard response is returned when a list of games are requested.
